Dead by Daylight ist ein gutes Game wo es 4 Survivor gegen 1 Killer spielen. Der Killer hat die Aufgabe die Survivor zu töten und das verhindern das die Generatoren repariert werden. Und die Aufgabe der Survivor ist zu überleben und die Generatoren zu reparieren um zu entkommen. Die Survivor und Killer haben unterschiedliche Perks die gute Fähigkeiten haben.

My absolute favorite game! Can be frustrating at times but I've never enjoyed a game more than Dead by Daylight.

I originally gave this game a negative review for reasons that are now being worked on by the developers (Behaviour). 

Killers are now starting to have M2 Powers being made more meaningful (unless you play Legion, who got nerfed again) with the addition of The Oni (December 2019). In addition, I am happy to DC-ing players finally being punished for their actions, which helps games to play out as they should and people earning more BP than before.

The community has gotten a lot better recently, with bugs bringing both sides of the game together in hopes to get them resolved asap.

Twitch streamers like Puppers, Monto, Otzdarva and No0b3 are great in showing you how to play both sides of the game more efficiently, and how to get better at playing each role - and I would advise watching both for the entertainment and knowledge that they offer.

All in all, Dead by Daylight is the game I will put the most time into (and will continue to put time into) due to it constantly being worked on despite its flaws.

UPDATE: Despite previous changes, the devs still haven't addressed the removal of the Hex: Ruin perk, and it is therefore pretty much impossible to do consistently well at high ranks as Killer now. I left this game back in January due to the poor balancing that the devs just simply are unable to understand and grasp. Would avoid keeping away until some actual changes are made instead of BHVR thinking of lining their back pockets with cheap cosmetics and poorly implemented Killer/Survivor releases.

I watched horror movies from my childhood and always sympathetically with people within. I love when the heroes fight against all odds and triumph at the end. Every loss that the hero has experience I have felt with him, so now with this game I can help my favorite characters and get rid of those pesky teens and have peace.

I'm normally not a fan of multiplayer games, but Dead by Daylight offers a unique experience. I mostly play as the killer, but I enjoy being a survivor mostly with friends. I love the characters in the game, and while I wish they had a bit more personality, especially the survivors, they're all really cool. Susie is my fav btw.

This is truly an amazing game, don't let yourself be turned off from it because you think you need friends to play, because you absolutely don't. However, like every game, it has its problems. There are lot's of bugs and balance issues take a big while to get fixed most of the time, if ever. That said, i still recommend the game because it's a very unique game that does it's job very well. All the dlc are awesome and the game is NOT pay to win.

Un gameplay asymétrique, assez équilibré pour les débutants, il est plus simple de faire 50/50 entre tueur et survivant pour voir comment fonctionne chaque tueurs et survivants disponible. l'hôte de la partie étant le tueur, je vous recommande d'avoir une bonne co pour ce jeu.
On pourrait croire que l'ambiance film d'horreur disparaît avec le temps, pas tant que ça. J'ai déjà sursauté de peur en voyant un fantôme sortir de nulle part sans le bruit du rayon de terreur.

I love to hate this game.
The game sometimes can feel very unfair, mostly because of your own decisions. Everything seems to be working fine, the game feels smooth. Every time you'll get hit during a chase you'll be saying "what? how did that hit?", but you'll get used to it. Pretty good job so far.
